title: Worked Solution
text:
To solve this equation, we need to get all the terms with q on one side of the equation and all the constants on the other side.
First, we can start by simplifying the left side of the equation:
$$8\left(q+1ight)-5=8q+8-5$$
$$=8q+3$$
Now let's simplify the right side of the equation:
$$3(2q-4)-1=6q-12-1$$
$$=6q-13$$
Now we have:
$$8q+3=6q-13$$
Next, we can get rid of the q terms by subtracting 6q from both sides:
$$8q-6q+3=6q-6q-13$$
$$2q+3=-13$$
Finally, we can get rid of the constant term by subtracting $$3$$ from both sides:
$$2q+3$$ - $$3=-13-3$$
$$2q=-16$$
Dividing both sides by $$2$$, we get:
$$q=-8$$
Therefore, the solution to the equation is $$q=-8$$.
